labels.analysis: The MCP Server described specializes in managing and automating Azure cloud resources by providing a natural language interface to Azure CLI commands. It focuses on executing cloud operations such as resource listing, configuration checks, security fixes, and resource creation, enabling users to interact with Azure without needing to construct manual CLI commands. The server integrates securely with local Azure credentials, enhancing cloud operational workflows.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cloud Services" was chosen because the server directly interacts with Azure cloud infrastructure using Azure CLI, making it a cloud management tool. The secondary label "Operating System" was selected due to its capability to execute system-level commands and configurations. The secondary label "Security & Authentication" is included because of its secure integration with Azure credentials.

server_info_crawled.overview: Enable seamless management of Azure resources through natural language by leveraging the full Azure CLI capabilities. Automate resource listing, configuration checks, security fixes, and resource creation with ease. Integrate securely with local Azure credentials to enhance your cloud operations workflow.

tools.name: execute-azure-cli-command
tools.description: Deploy Server Azure CLI Server @wang-qijia/azure-cli-mcp-server Try in Playground execute-azure-cli-command

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@wang-qijia/azure-cli-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
